meanings.definition: Wastries (noun): plural form of wastrie, meaning a wasteful or extravagant act or habit.
meanings.sent1: Her wastries of buying unnecessary items left her with little money at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The wastries of the wealthy often involve lavish parties and extravagant vacations.
meanings.sent3: Despite knowing the importance of saving, his wastries continued to drain his bank account.
meanings.sent4: Her wastries were like a leaky faucet, slowly dripping away her hard-earned savings.
meanings.sent5: The wastries of the queen were so grand that they became the talk of the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Wastries (verb): third person singular present of wastrie, meaning to engage in wasteful or extravagant behavior.
meanings.sent1: He wastries by constantly buying new gadgets he doesn't really need.
meanings.sent2: She wastries on designer clothes that she only wears once.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wastries by hoarding more acorns than it can possibly eat.
meanings.sent4: The company wastries resources on unnecessary projects instead of investing in growth.
meanings.sent5: The child wastries time playing video games instead of doing homework.
